radiofeed.common.utils package¶

Submodules¶

radiofeed.common.utils.dates module¶

radiofeed.common.utils.dates.parse_date(value)¶
radiofeed.common.utils.dates.parse_date(value: datetime)
radiofeed.common.utils.dates.parse_date(value: date)
radiofeed.common.utils.dates.parse_date(value: str)

Parses a date string or object and returns a timezone-aware datetime object.

If datetime passed will return the same instance with timezone awareness if not already present.

Invalid inputs will return None.

Parameters:

value (str | date | datetime | None) – value to parse

Returns:

timezone-aware datetime or None if invalid value.

Return type:

datetime | None

radiofeed.common.utils.html.strip_whitespace(value)¶

radiofeed.common.utils.iterators module¶

radiofeed.common.utils.iterators.batcher(iterable, batch_size)¶

Batches an iterable into lists of given batch size. Useful for handling long iterables where individual processing might be slow.

Parameters:

  • iterable (Iterable) – any iterable object

  • batch_size (int) – maximum size of each batch

Yields:

list – a list containing individual items in each batch

radiofeed.common.utils.text.lemmatized_tokens(text)¶

radiofeed.common.utils.xml module¶

class radiofeed.common.utils.xml.XPathFinder(element, namespaces=None)¶

Bases: object

Convenient class for doing XPath lookups to find text or attribute values on an XML element.

Parameters:

  • element (lxml.etree.Element) – the root element you want to search

  • namespaces (dict | None) – dict of XML namespaces

first(*paths, default=None)¶

Returns first matching text or attribute value. Tries each path in turn. If no values found returns default.

Parameters:

  • *paths (str) – list of XPath paths to search through in order

  • default (Any) – value returned if no result found

Returns:

string of text/attribute, or default value if none found

Return type:

Any

iter(*paths)¶

Iterates through xpaths and returns any non-empty text or attribute values matching the path. All strings are stripped of extra whitespace.

Parameters:

*paths (str) – list of XPath paths to search through in order

Yields:

str

radiofeed.common.utils.xml.parse_xml(content, *tags)¶

Iterates through elements in XML document with matching tag names.

Parameters:

  • content (bytes) – XML document

  • *tags (str) – tag names

Yields:

lxml.etree.Element

radiofeed.common.utils.xml.xpath_finder(element, namespaces=None)¶

Returns XPathFinder instance for an XML element as a context manager.

Parameters:

  • element (lxml.etree.Element) – the root element you want to search

  • namespaces (dict | None) – dict of XML namespaces

Yields:

XPathFinder
